definition: the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
a match for ten thousand enemies
a match for ten thousand enemies

sentences.chinese: 即使有30%的消耗？也還有20萬人。

sentences.english: Nearly 30,000 people have been killed since the campaign began.
sentences.chinese: 自從緝毒戰開始以來，已有近3萬人喪生。

sentences.english: It says more than three-hundred-thirty-five-million people lack enough water now.
sentences.chinese: 報告說如今世界上有三億三千五百萬人沒有足夠的水。
上週首次申領失業救濟金人數降至45萬人。
儘管他們不遺餘力救災，但還是有11萬人殞命。

sentences.english: During the week of the missed draw last spring some 26m Europeans bought tickets.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的這個春天，歐洲每週有2600萬人買彩票。

sentences.english: About 20,000 are taking language classes or other courses beneath the bachelor-degree level.
sentences.chinese: 約2萬人就讀本科學位以下的語言課程或其他課程。

sentences.english: More than 80,000 people were killed and dozens of towns destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 超過8萬人殞命，數十座城鎮被毀。

sentences.english: Now , the SDF consists of about 240,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 目前日本自衛隊的數量是24萬人左右。

sentences.english: If I speak in the tongues of men and of angles.
sentences.chinese: 假若我能說萬人的方言，並天使的話。

sentences.english: She says more than 270,000 people have received food assistance.
sentences.chinese: 她表示，已經有超過27萬人得到食品救濟。

sentences.english: Economists had expected claims to drop to 440, 000.
sentences.chinese: 而經濟學家預計下降人數爲44萬人。

sentences.english: The Confucius Institute Online has opened channels in 9 languages, with 100,000 registered users.
sentences.chinese: 網絡孔子學院開通9個語種，註冊用戶達10萬人。

sentences.english: More than 210,000 people have watched this clip.
sentences.chinese: 目前已有超過21萬人觀看了這段視頻。

sentences.english: Kaili has a population of 50, 000 and is a major producer of rice.
sentences.chinese: 凱裏市的人口約5萬人，也是水稻的主要產地。
